snippet: What started out as an emergency evacuation has become a semipermanent state of dislocation for thousands of city workers in Lower Manhattan offices.
abstract: Some 6,000 city workers from eight agencies remain displaced from offices rendered unusable because of flood damage or electrical problems, weeks after Hurricane Sandy ripped through New York City; what began as an emergency evacuation has become a semi-permanent state of dislocation for thousands of municipal employees in Lower Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: What started out as an emergency evacuation has become a semipermanent state of dislocation for thousands of city workers in Lower Manhattan offices.

headline.seo: Some City Employees Lost Their Offices in the Hurricane
headline.main: Hurricane Sandy’s Effects Leave Some Municipal Workers as Refugees, Too
headline.print_headline: Hurricane Sandy’s Effects Leave Some Municipal Workers as Refugees, Too
